Dialogue.Line: I'm scared. This place is like a maze. Where am I supposed to be going?
Your function is to obey, not question.
I may not have must time. I don't think they trust me, especially Tegan.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Turlough touches one at head height, then the one beneath it.
The roundel hinges down to reveal circuitry in the wall.

Dialogue.Line: Operate the blue switches. Now you'll be able to remove the space-time element from beneath the console.
Which switches will release the Tardis to my control?
Oh, no one. I was singing. Not very well, I'm afraid.
Why didn't you answer when I called?
I'm very sorry, I didn't hear you.
You're up to something, I can feel it.
I'm simply looking around. The Tardis is so very large.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The roundel drops open again.

Dialogue.Line: What have you been doing? Have you touched anything?
You look so sweet when you get angry.
I'm being serious. What have you been doing?
Nothing. You're being foolishly and unjustifiably suspicious. Tegan, why do you dislike me so much?
I heard the way you were talking to the Doctor.
Being friendly hardly makes me unreliable.
It's the way you were doing it.
Oh, you would prefer I used your sledgehammer tactics?
Being rude isn't honest. Neither is overreacting. If I choose to smooth the way with a smile and a soft phrase, that doesn't make me unreliable. Charm, the way I use it, is to disagree agreeably.
You were using it to deceive.
Oh, you're so typical of your planet, reduced to shouting if you can't have your own way.
No? You seem unable to grasp that there are other approaches. To smile before asking.
I'm simply relating what I think.
Turning an argument around is something you're very good at.
Listen to yourself. You're so concrete in the way you think. Why can't you just agree to differ?
I think we should try and be friends.
I'm going to tell the Doctor about the roundel.
Do so, but you'd only make a fool of yourself. I travel in the Tardis too, now. I have no desire to kill myself. I had no reason to open that roundel. Where are you going?
To show you to your room.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: While Nyssa is doing some experiment in the girl's room, Tegan shows Turlough to Adric's old quarters.

Dialogue.Line: I've had enough of children, what with that awful school on Earth.
You can change things if you want.
Right, all this can go for a start.
It's your room. Do what you like.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Tegan leaves with the Kinda necklace. Turlough comes out, rolling up his sleeves.

Dialogue.Line: He's got the manners of a pig.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The console room is deserted when Turlough sneaks in and takes the Guardian's crystal from his pocket. It glows.

Dialogue.Line: It's repaired itself. GUARDIAN [on scanner]: Concentrate. You have work to do.
Synthesising an enzyme. I seem to need the practice.
Adric did the calculation for me. My own figures aren't as good, as you can see.
I'll see if I can find his notes, before Turlough destroys them.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Turlough is trying to pull a component out of the console base.

Dialogue.Line: What will this do? GUARDIAN [on scanner]: You are touching the heart of the Tardis. Rip it free!
What happens to me? GUARDIAN [on scanner]: You will be safe. I am ready to lift you away.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The console starts beeping and flashing, and the time rotor stops moving.
Tegan knocks on the door then enters.

Dialogue.Line: I'm trying. It won't move. GUARDIAN [on scanner]: The break-up is beginning. I can sense it. Remove the space-time element!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: There is a hazy mist in front of Tegan.
The mist effect is entering the girl's room through the wall. Nyssa turns to stare at it.
The Doctor runs up to the mist.

Dialogue.Line: We're in trouble. I'll explain later.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Turlough gets out from under the console and grabs the crystal just before the Doctor and Tegan run in.

Dialogue.Line: Nothing that could have caused this.
The rotor's jamming. Well, there's a safety cut out.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor pulls it out.

Dialogue.Line: Well, we'll see. I'm trying to refocus the exterior viewer on the interior of the Tardis.
Dimensional instability, that's the danger. Nyssa!
Stay well back. There's nothing you can do. Nyssa?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The scanner view is looking over Nyssa's shoulder into the swirly effect.

Dialogue.Line: What's that? I saw something just for a moment.
Oh, no. The outside universe is breaking through.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The image of a skull is visible.
As Nyssa hugs her notebook, her apparatus starts to explode. She squeals and turns away.
The image of a skull is on a solid door which is opening.

Dialogue.Line: Go through, Nyssa. It's your only chance.
I don't know, but if she stays in the room, she'll die.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Nyssa takes a final look over her shoulder, then the screen goes white.

Dialogue.Line: Nyssa, if you can hear me,

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Nyssa walks through into a corridor.

Dialogue.Line: Keep moving. Keep moving, Nyssa. Stay ahead of it. If you don't, it will kill you.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Nyssa drops her notebook and runs.
The image on the scanner clears to show the girl's room. There is a background thrumming sound.

Dialogue.Line: Where does that door lead to?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The door is beginning to close.
The Doctor pushes past Tegan and they all run out.
The Doctor throws a metal chair into the remaining gap to keep the door open.

Dialogue.Line: Where did the other spacecraft come from?
The Tardis found it. There's a fail-safe. On impending break-up, it seeks out and locks onto the nearest spacecraft.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor crawls under the chair into the corridor. Tegan starts to follow.
There is a distant whirring sound.
Turlough takes out the crystal.
Turlough crawls into the corridor. Suddenly the chair is pulled from the gap and the door slams shut.
The skull motif disappears and it becomes part of the corridor wall.

Dialogue.Line: It seems we have no choice. We go on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Further on, the Doctor finds handprints on the wall.

Dialogue.Line: What have I sent you into, Nyssa?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A spaceship docks. There is that whirring sound again.

Dialogue.Line: Come on, we can catch up with the Doctor. Come on!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Nyssa hides below a staircase as she hears someone coming. It's the Doctor. He sees her curled up into a little ball.
She runs into his arms.

Dialogue.Line: I think it's some sort of old passenger liner.
Yes, well, some people have the strangest ideas about decor. Come on, let's get back to the Tardis.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Elsewhere, there is an explosion as someone blows a hole in a bulkhead, then comes through wearing an enormous clear space helmet. She speaks to the man following her.
The hole has filled up with foam.
In yet another corridor -

Dialogue.Line: I'm positive that was Nyssa calling.
You heard something. Your imagination did the rest.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They walk round a corner.
A metal contraption spots them and starts chirruping.
The two newcomers enter. Kari checks the atmosphere then they both remove their helmets before going down the steps to look at the equipment.

Dialogue.Line: The whole ship's rigged to run on automatic, yet there's atmosphere. It doesn't fit the briefing at all.
So what? We're only here for the cargo.
Would it really surprise you if there weren't any? This ship is dead.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor and Nyssa arrive at the mended breach.

Dialogue.Line: Ah. I don't remember this. We must have taken a wrong turn.
A massive plug. The hull must have been damaged at some time.
Yes, I know. Come on, we'll try, er, this way.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Kari uses her communicator.

Dialogue.Line: Advance party to raider. We're coming back. This isn't the ship you described.
We can't go back if he doesn't link with the airlock.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: It appears to be empty. Then Olvir comes up from behind a console and points his weapon at the Doctor and Nyssa.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, dear. So sorry, I didn't know it was private.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Kari appears behind them.

Dialogue.Line: That's all right. We're in the mood for company.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Tegan goes to the door and starts pressing buttons on a panel. Meanwhile, the raider undocks from the spaceship.

Dialogue.Line: Be quiet. If you're not members of the crew, how did you get here?
We have a ship of our own.
So they're after the cargo, too.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The raider fires its engines.

Dialogue.Line: That's our ship! He's running out on us!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: She uses her communicator.

Dialogue.Line: Advance party to raider. Come in, raider. Come in. (static) Is this your work?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A console starts beeping.

Dialogue.Line: Hold on, Nyssa. We must find something to lever the door open.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Turlough goes down the corridor to get instructions, but the crystal refuses to glow. He picks up Nyssa's notebook.
Turlough puts his hands against the bulkhead where the door originally was.
Turlough starts to walk away, and the skull motif appears.
Tegan has got the door slightly open.
Hands reach through the gap and grab her all over. Turlough runs back.
Turlough pulls her out of their grasp and the door closes again.

Dialogue.Line: Are you all right? I found the doorway to the Tardis.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The doorway fades again.

Dialogue.Line: Raiders, by the look of it. Probably an advance party to open the airlocks.
You say you have a ship?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Kari and Olvir point their guns at Nyssa.

Dialogue.Line: Stop bluffing. You haven't got a chance. Listen to the engines. Alignment manoeuvres. We're docking with another ship.
Then I'm asking you, will you take us off this ship?
If you put the guns away, please.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: After a moment's hesitation, they holster their weapons.

Dialogue.Line: All decks stand by. All decks stand by. This is a special announcement from Terminus Incorporated.
I think we should get out of here. Follow me.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor, Nyssa, Kari and Olvir run up the steps and leave.

Dialogue.Line: Primary docking alignment procedures are now complete. Passengers with mobility should prepare to disembark.
Anyone failing to disembark will be removed. Sterilisation procedures will then follow.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Tegan and Turlough watch as all the skull motif doors in the corridor open, and groaning voices can be heard..

Dialogue.Line: There is no return. This is Terminus.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Olvir runs away.
A crowd of cloaked people shuffle past, groaning. Meanwhile -
Turlough starts to prise open a floor plate.

Dialogue.Line: Give me a hand. Come on, quickly.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Tegan and Turlough get under the floor before the crowd arrives. The Doctor and Nyssa watch from a staircase. Olvir has run back to the bridge entrance.

Dialogue.Line: Now we know, don't we? Now we know what its all about.
This is Terminus, where all the lazars come to die.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The spaceship docks with a massive space station.

Dialogue.Line: Whatever you do, don't let them touch you.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ah, so that's why Nyssa is only wearing a sleeveless top with her miniskirt. Kari has got her gun out.

Dialogue.Line: No! That would be mass slaughter.
I thought they were going to attack us.
Look at them. I doubt if they can feed themselves, let alone fight.
No. I rather think he's got a lot to tell us.
It's those things walking over the grating.
There must be another way out.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: She starts to crawl along and a panel falls open, glowing green.

Dialogue.Line: This place is a death trap.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They crawl off in the other direction.

Dialogue.Line: What are the lazars doing here?
Dying. Some cargo you came to steal.
Why did you choose this ship?
It was a big liner from a rich sector. It looked like the perfect target, so we thought.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor gets a monitor working.

Dialogue.Line: Now, what about Terminus? We must find Olvir.
Wait. There's a ladder. This way.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor is rearranging chips in the computer panel.

Dialogue.Line: Hurry, Doctor. I want to get off this ship as soon as possible.
In a moment. Can you see any more computer blocks?
What precisely are you looking for?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Nyssa leans against the stair rails for a few moments to rest, then moves on.

Dialogue.Line: Information about Terminus. There must be something here, the liner's just docked with it.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Nyssa sees Olvir hiding under behind a chair.
Tegan climbs on as Turlough takes out his crystal.

Dialogue.Line: The Doctor still lives. You know the rewards for success. I have other rewards for your failure.
Coming. Come and talk to the Doctor. We need your help. You know about Terminus.
I'm supposed to be combat trained, and I ran away.
What do you make of this?
Whatever you're planning, you can forget it, because we're dead. We're breathing in the disease at this very moment.
Nyssa's right. How do you know about Lazar's disease?
Yes. They supposedly offer a cure, but I've never met anyone who came back.
And you didn't try and find out why?
From whom? A commercial company runs Terminus. They don't care about anything apart from their profit.
How are they allowed to get away with it?
They just play on irrational fear, just like the old plagues. They terrified people and this is no different. It isn't something you admit to.
What do you make of this?
An expanded chart of the universe.
In all you heard about Terminus, was there ever any comment on its position?
There's something very strange about this.
Well, it could be pure coincidence, but Terminus seems to be at the exact centre of the known universe.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Turlough catches up with Tegan, who still cannot move any floor plates to get out.
A figure in full body armour decorated like a skeleton, wearing a red cloak tied above the head like a shroud, stops right above them before moving on to the robotic device seen earlier.
The robot chirps its report, and the figure raises his face plate to show pale skin and sunken eyes.
Tegan and Turlough crawl on through what I hesitate to call the Jefferies tubes.
Another armoured figure with a brown cloak looks at a display panel and his PADD then removes his helmet.

Dialogue.Line: What's happening? The reading's still climbing.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He wanders off through an opening with black and yellow markings around it. Valgard enters.
Valgard stops at the markings.

Dialogue.Line: The reading's still climbing. I must find out what's happening.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Valgard rushes in.

Dialogue.Line: Eirak, Bor has just entered the Forbidden Zone.
I can't afford to send men after him.
This is my responsibility. To keep Terminus running.
We can't just let him die.
Valgard, we're all dying. Did Bor say anything before he entered the Zone?
He muttered something about the readings.
He'll be back, when he gets hungry or needs his Hydromel.
This could be useful. Plan of the ship.
It's no wonder we got lost.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The power goes off.

Dialogue.Line: Attention. Preparations for departure will begin with stage one sterilisation. Unprotected personnel are advised to leave this liner immediately. No return will be permitted. This warning is final. Stage one sterilisation is now commencing.
We must get out of here.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: There's a hissing sound near Turlough and Tegan.
Gas starts to fill the area.

Dialogue.Line: Must be to do with the sterilising.
Who was that voice talking to?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Nyssa takes a piece of punch tape from a printer.

Dialogue.Line: This is a layout of the ship. There are two ways back to where we think the Tardis is. We must go in two parties.
We were lucky. It got vented away.
All right then, but only for a moment. What's the matter?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He takes out his communicator.

Dialogue.Line: There's leak interference. There must be bad shielding on the engine somewhere.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The robot enters.

Dialogue.Line: I don't know. I feel, I feel as if I'm going to burst.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Nyssa unfastens her mini-skirt and lets it drop to the floor. Fortunately she is wearing a slip underneath it.
Olvir puts his hand on Nyssa's shoulder, then pulls away.
The robot approaches.
Kari and the Doctor hear the announcement too.

Dialogue.Line: All Lazars and any other personnel must disembark immediately. Stage two sterilisation is about to begin.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The robot grabs Nyssa's wrist.
The robot starts to drag Nyssa away.

Dialogue.Line: All Lazars must comply with the drones.
All Lazars must comply with the drones.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Olvir looks away.

Dialogue.Line: We haven't got time. Come on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The guards are bringing in Lazars.

Dialogue.Line: Get in there. Valgard, don't anger Eirak. He has great power.
The only power he has is in the control of the Hydromel. Without that, we're all dead.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The door opens to reveal Nyssa.

Dialogue.Line: This one's in better condition than most.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Valgard leads Nyssa to the other Lazars, and stumbles.

Dialogue.Line: Where's that drone with the Hydromel?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sigurd leaves.

Dialogue.Line: I'm not one of the Lazars.
Baggage handlers. We just receive and pass on.
But I have to know what's happening.
You'll be taken to the Garm. Thereafter, who knows? No one's ever come back from a meeting with him.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sigurd hits a wall panel and another one labelled Hazard opens. He removes a large box. That in turn holds four boxes which each contain several layers of three recycled Blake's 7 mutoid serum phials, which glow lime green. Sigurd swaps a new one for the old one in his breast plate.

Dialogue.Line: Radiation levels. What are you doing?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: As Valgard leans over to look, Nyssa gets her hand under his chin and pushes him away. She starts to run but Sigurd comes back with the box of phials.

Dialogue.Line: The Garm awaits. There's no escape, not for you. All right, Valgard?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Olvir watches them take Nyssa away to a simple platform elevator, and go down.

Dialogue.Line: We can't have missed the door. There was a book lying on the floor.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor finds Nyssa's skirt by a staircase.

Dialogue.Line: Nyssa's skirt. There's blood on it. Call Olvir, quickly.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sigurd and Valgard bring Nyssa in.

Dialogue.Line: Has anybody told the Garm to look out for Bor in the Forbidden Zone?
If he dies, we'll want his body back for the armour. Valgard, see to it at once.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sigurd takes Nyssa away. Valgard gives Eirak a long, hard stare before leaving.

With his face mask down, Valgard waves his hand over a communication unit, which starts beeping. After a few moments a figure with glowing red eyes emerges from the Forbidden Zone and stops behind the black and yellow markings.
The biped, with the face of a giant Highland Terrier and forward pointing ears, nods.

Dialogue.Line: One of the Vanir has entered the Forbidden Zone. If he has died, we must have his body back. You understand?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Garm bows.

Dialogue.Line: More spots of blood. Try them again.
There must be a radiation leak.
That's the wave pattern the Tardis homed in on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Gas is beginning to enter the corridor.
The Doctor and Kari dive under the closing door between the spaceship and Terminus just in time.
The lights go out.
Valgard watches the Doctor and Kari walk along an upper catwalk.
Valgard goes after them.

Dialogue.Line: He couldn't have heard us. We're going to get out of here even if we have to smash our way out.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The third bar he tries to move gives way, and they carry on.
The Doctor manages to break Valgard's grip on his throat, while Kari recovers her gun. Valgard has the Doctor from behind now, and she can't get a clear shot.
Kari fires her energy beam at a piece of metal leaning against the wall. It reflects off it and straight onto Valgard's helmet. He screams and releases the Doctor before collapsing.

Dialogue.Line: No. He's wearing radiation armour. Keep him covered.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor leads Kari into the Forbidden Zone. Valgard recovers and sees where they have gone, and leaves. Meanwhile, Olvir hides from a pair of Vanir and discovers where they keep the spare armour. Turlough uses the bar to smash through a wall panel into a spaceship corridor.
Which looks just like the rest of Terminus, actually, all metal staircases and scaffolding tubes.

Dialogue.Line: Well, at least the level's acceptable, for the time being. Come on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Garm follows them.
Nyssa has been dressed in the same drab robe as the rest of the Lazars.
The Vanir leave. A female Lazar speaks to Nyssa.

Dialogue.Line: You'll get nothing out of them. They're not interested.
I've got to make them understand.
You can't even bribe them. The only thing they care about is Hydromel, the drug that keeps them alive.
What are they going to do with us?
Supposedly cure us, but I rather think they're going to let us die.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Eirak replenishes his own Hydromel supply, makes a note on a PADD, then discovers a pale phial in the box. Sigurd enters with a clip board.

Dialogue.Line: Lazar assessment from tank three, Eirak.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Eirak throws the phial on the floor.

Dialogue.Line: Coloured water. They must think we're fools. They've even reduced the size of the consignment.
But we process everyone who comes here. Why doesn't the Company send someone to see the conditions we work under?
Maybe they already have. We are slaves. The Company doesn't need to tell us anything.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Valgard enters.

Dialogue.Line: Intruders. I saw two people down in the stockyard, a man and a girl. They went into the Forbidden Zone.
No. No, they were too fit. And they were armed.
Why are they in the Forbidden Zone?

The perfect place to hide. We never go there. As the Company has decided to cut back our supply of Hydromel, it is in our own interest to learn why. If the couple in the Forbidden Zone are from the Company, their knowledge is vital.
Why don't you? You're supposed to be our honoured leader.
So you keep telling us, although I sometimes wonder whether we need you at all.
You think you could be better?
All right, I'll make you an offer. Bring back the spies and I'll step down in your favour.
I have your word on that?
You have the Vanir as your witness. Think of it as a bet. If you're ambitious enough, you'll accept it.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Valgard leaves.

Dialogue.Line: He'll die in the Forbidden Zone.
And you will give him what you say?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Nyssa gives up trying to open the door.

Dialogue.Line: There's no way out, just as there's no cure. It's hopeless.
Tell me about the Forbidden Zone.
You don't give up, do you.
I only know what I've heard. It's where the radiation's too strong for them, and where we're supposed to be cured.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Olvir is wearing a cloak and looking for a serviceable helmet. He has his back to the door when Sigurd enters.

Dialogue.Line: They're starting to move the Lazars. Tank three.
I'll be down in a moment.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Turlough and Tegan sneak under the camera view of a drone.

Dialogue.Line: I've just come from the equipment store. I think we have a third intruder.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Two Vanir leave.

Dialogue.Line: It seems Valgard's mission was unnecessary after all. Come on, we'll apprehend this one ourselves.
Why do the crew put up with such a radiation leak?
It could be part of the cure.
Olvir said there wasn't one. So, why don't they repair it?
They may not know how to.
Hmm. Radiation. Fallout. Now that's a thought.
Nothing. Just an idea worth pursuing.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The cloaked figure does not move. Eirak goes over and knocks the dummy down.

Dialogue.Line: Perhaps you're developing the Lazar disease.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Olvir enters. Valgard throws down his helmet.
Valgard enters the Forbidden Zone.
Eirak examines Nyssa's face.

Dialogue.Line: It's hardly touched. Take her first, then.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A Vanir comes over and takes Nyssa's arm.

Dialogue.Line: No. No, wait. Others are worse than me.
The fit ones go first. Take her.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Tegan and Turlough are sitting disconsolately on a staircase.

Dialogue.Line: If ever you had to kill someone, could you do it? Could you?
No. I don't know. If it was important, to save my friend, to defend myself.
You're weird, Turlough. What a subject to bring up at a time like this. Come on, let's find the control room.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Tegan leaves.
The 'singer' is Bor, dragging some heavy metal pieces along in his cloak.

Dialogue.Line: Well, he seems happy enough. Let's find out.
He's hurt. Hello, I'm the Doctor. Can I help?
Most kind. Yes. A burden is a, er, something or other. Most kind. Thanks. This way.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Bor gives the Doctor the end of the cloak and goes off mumbling.

Dialogue.Line: The cold ground. Rest in peace.
Curious. What do you make of this?
It's a map. Like one of those diagrams when they thought the Earth was at the centre of the universe.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Still sort of singing, Bor leads the Doctor and Kari along.

Dialogue.Line: Terminus entrance. At least we know where the radiation comes from.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Bor starts to pile the metal up against a barricade in front of a large glowing object in the wall.

Dialogue.Line: Look at the damage. Easy now.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They drag Bor away.

Dialogue.Line: Thank you. Most kind. Most kind. My name is, er, Bor. I. Haven't we met somewhere before?
Short term memory's the first to go.
Do you know anything about engines?
I tried to pull down the control cables. I picked the wrong ones. Power lines. As I couldn't stop the radiation, I had to try and wall it in. Now things are even worse.
The whole lot's unstable. Know what would happen if one of those exploded? It'd be more than just a loud bang.
Nothing in the universe would be safe.
Did I tell you? One of the engines has already exploded.
No, oh, it was a long time ago. It's all in the computer. That one will go next. I didn't find out why until I followed the control cables.
Why wasn't Terminus destroyed in the explosion?
Tell them nothing, Bor. They're Company spies.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Kari levels her gun at Valgard.

Dialogue.Line: You forget our last encounter. The power pack is exhausted. I'm taking you back, but not before I've beaten some respect into you.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor dodges the first two swings, then takes a blow on the arm from Valgard's staff. A few more swipes, and the Doctor grabs the staff. There is a brief trial of strength, and Valgard is thrown against the barricade in front of the engine.
The Doctor goes to help Bor and Valgard. The Garm enters.
Nyssa is being shackled to a pipe.

Dialogue.Line: Let me go. Please, please, let me go.
Don't you want to be cured? This is for your own good.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sigurd summons the Garm.

Dialogue.Line: At least, that's what I'm told.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Garm has picked up Bor.
The Garm leaves, carrying Bor in its arms.
The Doctor and Kari leave. Valgard wakes up.
Nyssa screams.

Dialogue.Line: Your cure. The Garm's found Bor.
Let's get him to Eirak while he can still talk.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Two Vanir carry Bor out, followed by Sigurd. Olvir goes to Nyssa
Olvir takes off his helmet.

Dialogue.Line: I can't, I'm not strong enough.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Garm approaches.

Dialogue.Line: Olvir! (Olvir fires his gun at the Garm. It has no effect. The Garm goes to Nyssa.)
What are you looking for now?
The control lines. The ones Bor said he followed.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Garm has freed Nyssa and hoisted her over its shoulder. It carries her into the Forbidden Zone. After a moment, Olvir follows.

Dialogue.Line: There must be a way to recreate the door we entered this ship by. Wait here.
This is a complete waste of time. Bor doesn't know what he's talking about. He's suffering from radiation sickness.
Yes, you're right about the sickness. I want to find out what he discovered.
I think it could be rather important.
Why did you do it? You knew you couldn't survive in the Forbidden Zone.
Worth a try. The pilot's dead, you know.
But he's still there. He's going to fire up the engines again and they won't take it and the big bang will happen all over again.
He didn't have it. He's delirious. He needs Hydromel.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Turlough gets out the crystal.

Dialogue.Line: You have not destroyed the Doctor.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Turlough suddenly stiffens, writhes and falls to his knees.

Dialogue.Line: I will, I will. I have a plan.
I do! But I need to get back to the Tardis.
How do I recreate the door?
Then search for an emergency bypass switch.
You have skills. Use them. Look beneath your feet.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The crystal goes out. Tegan comes up.

Dialogue.Line: Remember when we were underneath the floor? Well, I noticed something familiar. It's only just come to me what it was. Come on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor is still following the cable on the wall.
There is a mummified pilot in the main seat just like in Alien, and a second empty seat.
The Garm is tying Nyssa up in front of the engine.
Valgard hits Olvir in the stomach with his staff.

Dialogue.Line: Do you remember Bor saying one of the engines had exploded?
He was wrong. It didn't come to that. Look at this. Terminus was once capable of time travel.
Well, to push a ship of this size through time would require an enormous amount of energy.

Well, think about what we've learnt. Terminus seems to be at the centre of the universe, yes? Now, imagine this ship in flight. Suddenly the pilot finds he has an enormous amount of unstable fuel on board. What would you do?
Perfectly normal procedure. Unfortunately, he ejects his fuel into a void.
Enormous. Biggest explosion of all time. Event One.
A chemical reaction in a primeval swamp can create life on a planet. Why couldn't the universe be created by a similar chance factor, hmm?
But exploding fuel in space? It's almost too simple.
It only appears simple because the circumstances were exactly right.
Well, if what you're saying is right, why wasn't Terminus destroyed in the explosion?
Well, the pilot time-jumped the ship forward before realising how unstable the fuel was. The resulting shockwave must have caught up with him, boosting the ship billions of years into the future.
Killing the pilot and damaging the second engine.
If there was a second explosion, would it have the same effect as the jettisoned fuel?
Not quite. Whereas the first explosion created the universe, the second would undoubtedly destroy it.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Turlough hammers at a 'No Touch' labelled panel until it falls off to reveal a green glow and some circuitry.

Dialogue.Line: There it is. Emergency bypass. We'll soon have that door open.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Turlough pulls at a wire. There's a big flash.
The Doctor takes off his jacket.
A red handle moves forward a notch.
Valgard takes some more swipes at Olvir with his staff, and misses. The Garm enters and Nyssa screams. Valgard and Olvir fight hand to hand. Olvir defeats Valgard as the Garm carries Nyssa off.
There is a humming sound.
Above them, in the corridor, the skull motif appears briefly on a wall panel.

Dialogue.Line: We must make it materialise fully.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They go back to the circuitry.

Dialogue.Line: Let me help. It's not going to defeat us now.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Olvir reaches for a gun on the floor near the engine.

Dialogue.Line: I wouldn't. The radiation'll kill you. Get much closer and you're dead, unless you can get to a decontamination unit.
Please yourself, then, but in my day we were better trained.
You're not from the Company. You're combat trained. Colonel Pereira, was it? The one they call the Chief?
Recognise the moves. Taught the same ones to me. I was with him for five tours, till he turned me in for the reward.
And how did you get here?
Slave labour. That's how Terminus works. You couldn't pay anyone enough to work here.
Don't need them. If we don't work, we don't get the Hydromel we need to stay alive. Help me, please. Oh, come on. Look at me. I'm a danger to no one. I'm finished. I'm dying.
Where did that thing take Nyssa?
Nyssa? Oh, is that her name? I've no idea. This is my first time in the Zone.
No. He's curing her. That's what he's here for.
How can that thing cure anyone?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Olvir picks up his cloak and runs off. Valgard smiles and gets up, then uses his staff to drag the gun away from the engine.
The Doctor and Kari are trying to push the red handle back to where it started.

Dialogue.Line: It's controlled by the computer, and the computer's uncontrollable.
I don't think I've got any skin left on my hands.
Primary ignition is now beginning. All systems running on test. Departure sequence is beginning now.
No, wait! You can't leave yet!
All drones to designated assembly points. Countdown to secondary ignition follows.
The ship's on automatic, Tegan. There's nothing you can do.
Departure sequence is now underway. Countdown to docking disengagement now beginning.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Tegan runs in and goes to the main control console.

Dialogue.Line: Preparing to blow clamps and withdraw all lines.
Countdown to primary burn is now underway.
Countdown to primary burn is now underway.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The doorway fully materialises.

Dialogue.Line: Test mode on all systems is now disengaged.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Tegan tries turning every available button.

Dialogue.Line: All systems operating within permitted tolerances.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: She hits a console with her fist.

Dialogue.Line: Emergency, emergency. Launch abort. Launch abort.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The door into the Tardis is gently closing.
Turlough runs into the console room. Nyssa wakes up in a large white room. She appears to be cured.
The Doctor tries to move the handle back with a metal bar. It bends the bar.

Dialogue.Line: How can this ship still be operational after all this time?
The technology here is phenomenal, unfortunately. There must be a way to reset that handle.
He must have had the strength of a giant.
But will there still be enough time?
Well, we can only hope there is.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They run out. The handle moves forward another notch.

Dialogue.Line: He's trapped. He's powerless, probably dead already. GUARDIAN [on scanner]: You represent a poor investment of my time and energy, and for such an investment there is only one course to follow.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A blinding flash comes from the Guardian's crystal. Turlough screams.
The Garm meets Olvir.

Dialogue.Line: I'm unarmed. Can you understand me?
Why are you doing this? You're torturing people.
I draw the disease from them. All would die but most survive.
And the last one you treated, Nyssa, did she survive?
It doesn't matter. In a couple of hours there won't even be a Terminus or a Company or anything. I found some information in a computer.
That's the trouble. I can't remember.
Short term memory is always the first to go.
Look, I'll get some Hydromel. There's a case of it through there.
Who said I was going to ask him?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sigurd checks that the coast is clear, and goes to the stack of Hydromel boxes. They have been secured with a padlock that beeps when Sigurd tries to undo it.

Dialogue.Line: It really isn't worth the trouble, you know.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor takes the signalling device in hand.

The beep fills the Forbidden Zone. Olvir tries to break into the room where Nyssa is recovering, dressed only in her skivvies again. She hides behind the door, ready to pounce. Meanwhile, the red handle moves forward another notch.

Dialogue.Line: He's coming. What do we do now?
Let's just get into the control room. I'll do the rest.
We'll humour him. Right, let's go.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The signal stops and will not restart.

Dialogue.Line: Deception is unnecessary. You have given the signal, I must obey.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Olvir breaks into the room and falls over Nyssa's leg. She leaps onto his chest.

Dialogue.Line: Nyssa! You came through the cure.
I was simply exposed to a massive dose of radiation. There's no proper diagnosis, no control, and this is supposed to be someone's idea of decontamination.
Well, let's go. The sooner we can put Terminus behind us
You don't understand. There must be thousands of people who've passed through here and think they're cured. It's all just hit and miss. No one cares.
Listen to me. The cure works, but it needs to be controlled, otherwise you just trade one killer for another. Radiation induced diseases that may take years to show.
Let's just concentrate on getting away, shall we?
I've no doubt you're right, but we can argue your case later. Now come on, quickly.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Another Lazar is being chained up when Eirak discovers that the Garm's summoning device has gone.

Dialogue.Line: Who took it? Who took the signal box? Someone will suffer for this.
You understand what we need you to do?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The red handle moves forward another notch.

Dialogue.Line: I'd appreciate it if you'd hurry.
If you can return the lever, I can disconnect the computer controlling it.
It's the end of the universe.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Garm grasps the handle.
Terminus starts to shake.
The Doctor starts to take apart computer panels.

Dialogue.Line: It must. You must push harder. It's the only way.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Nyssa and Olvir are thrown against the walls as the engine gets brighter and brighter. Finally the Garm gets the handle to move.
The Garm returns the handle to its start position and the engine sound dies down.
The Doctor flicks some switches and pulls out a fistful of wires.

Dialogue.Line: Do something for me. Destroy the box. Set me free.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor picks up the signal box and smashes it on the floor.

Dialogue.Line: Rest. You've earned it. Come on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor picks up his jacket and leaves with Kari.

Dialogue.Line: Disconnect the control lines to the engines.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They meet Valgard and his gun.

Dialogue.Line: Look, whoever you are, we haven't got time for

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Nyssa and Olvir are on a lower level.

Dialogue.Line: You're taking a very narrow view of all this.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Nyssa and Olvir hide as Valgard brings the Doctor and Kari down the stairs.

Dialogue.Line: I want to stay alive. If that's a narrow view, then you're right.
You're quite happy to see things go on as they are.
Happy? This is Terminus. No one's happy here. Staying alive is all that counts.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Valgard turns.
Olvir kicks the gun out of Valgard's hand and Kari picks it up.

Dialogue.Line: I'm fine. Doctor, I've made a fantastic discovery. The cure for Lazar disease works.
The system is far from safe.
Well, you think it could be?
With the Garm's help, yes. It's only his lack of free will which has prevented him from doing anything about it.
She's sick. She doesn't know what she's talking about.
With changes, Terminus could work, become a proper hospital.
Are you, though? And the other Vanir?
Even if we were, it's not possible without Hydromel, and it's the Company who control that.
But if you had an endless supply of it, you'd be free of their control, wouldn't you?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Bor wakes up, muttering.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, funny, I could have sworn that. But still, it's a relief. I am hoping for something rather better on the other side. Sigurd
Sleep? It's all I can do to keep awake for more than a minute.
Shush. I've got some people with me.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They cross the room.
The Doctor, Nyssa, Kari and Olvir enter.

Dialogue.Line: They say they can free us from the Company.
You know anybody harder to convince?
It's locked. Olvir, may I borrow your laser?
Now if this is just some madcap scheme for getting back at Eirak, then you've got another thing coming.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor lasers the padlock on the stack of Hydromel and give Olvir the gun back. Then he takes out a box and opens it.

Dialogue.Line: You're the expert, what do you think?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Nyssa examines a phial.

Dialogue.Line: Look, er, while we're sorting things out here, perhaps you'd be so good as to cut the control lines to the engines. I'd hate anyone to start the sequence manually.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Kari and Olvir leave.

Dialogue.Line: I might even improve on it.
Well, how's this supposed to free us from the Company?
Terminus Incorporated only control you because they supply you with Hydromel, but if you produced your own
But the Company would send troops. They'd destroy us.
With the current reputation Lazar disease has, would any sane soldier come here?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Nyssa gives Sigurd a phial of Hydromel.

Dialogue.Line: Are you sure these are the right cables?
It's what you said about this ship. I'd hate to end the universe by mistake.
No, no, I'll, I'll do it. Just wanted to be certain.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Kari stands behind Olvir as he zaps the cables on the wall. The engine goes dark.
Eirak enters with other Vanir.

Dialogue.Line: I want it found. Without the signal box we've got no control over the Garm.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Then he sees Valgard.

Dialogue.Line: Pleased to see me? I want you to meet some people.
How do you do? I'm the Doctor, and this is Nyssa.
All right, Valgard, what do you think you're doing?
I think you owe me something.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sigurd and Bor stand beside him.

Dialogue.Line: A small matter of your position here.
If I bring back the intruders, your position is mine, remember? There he is.
We all think it's time for a little chat.
Yes, well, before you start, perhaps one of you could show us the way to the damaged engine. There's still a great deal to be done.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Kari looks at the bundle of severed wires.

Dialogue.Line: Have you given any thought as to how we're going to get home?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Meanwhile, Valgard is escorting the Doctor and Nyssa.

Dialogue.Line: It'll be good to see the Tardis again.
Yes, well, it'll be nice to know she's safe. Tegan!
I was trying to reach you. Turlough went back to the Tardis on his own.
I told you not to follow me.
Doctor, say you're pleased to see her.
Yes, well, I'm pleased to see her but she shouldn't have followed us.
Yes, well, we'll talk about it later. Valgard?
He has a great deal to do.
Tegan, I have to tell you something.
Now it's important you inform the authorities about what's been going on here. Make it impossible for Terminus Incorporated to retaliate. For example, you must make contact with the pick-up ship.
The one that takes the cured Lazars away. Well, the Garm will know all about it.
We no longer have any control over him.
Then speak to him, win his confidence. You'll find him very agreeable.
There's too much to be done here.
Well, you can't stay. It isn't safe. Certainly not until the Vanir have sorted out how they're to run Terminus.
And with my skills, I can help them.
I've enjoyed every moment of my time on the Tardis, and I'll miss you both, but here I have a chance to put into practice the skills I learnt on Traken.
I'm adamant. Please, let us part in good faith.
You do fully understand the commitment you'll be undertaking?
And that life here will be very hard.
I am fully aware of that, but I want to stay.
Then you're a very brave person. I wish you every luck.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Nyssa kisses the Doctor on the cheek.

Dialogue.Line: Not easily, Tegan. Like you, I'm indestructible.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The girls hug, tearfully.
Turlough is lying on the floor of the console room.

Dialogue.Line: What? GUARDIAN [on scanner]: The Doctor is returning.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He does look pale and sweaty.

Dialogue.Line: This is your last chance, boy.
What did you do to me? GUARDIAN [on scanner]: You will recover.
I can't go on. Kill the Doctor yourself. Blame me for it, I don't care. I can't do it. GUARDIAN [on scanner]: You have little choice.
Turlough? Turlough! GUARDIAN [on scanner]: He's coming, boy. This is your last chance. I shall not say that again. Kill the Doctor!
